mn29:1.2: Devadatta was the Buddha’s cousin and nemesis. After going forth together with several other family members of the Buddha ([pli-tv-kd17:1.4.1]()), his initial success in meditation was corrupted by his desire for gains and fame ([sn17.35]()). He tried to take over the Saṅgha but was denounced by the Buddha. His attempt to create a schismatic faction failed and he died in disgrace.
mn29:2.9: Compare the “noble quest” on [mn26]() and the search for a “bull elephant” in [mn27](). In each case the metaphor emphasizes the specific and uncompromising nature of the goal.
